intro: Limonia retusa, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Limonia retusa is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
